metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32548 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would follow symbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the openjdk-8 package apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32548` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-gtk - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-kde - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-noui - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-retrace - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-valgrind - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
dh-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
python-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
python-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
python3-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
python3-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apport package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7').
